pageContext.claim: “Here in Philadelphia, the murder rate has been steady — I mean just terribly increasing.”
pageContext.analysis: This is wrong. Murders have declined significantly in Philadelphia over the past decade, from 397 in 2007 to 277 in 2016; the number has been below 300 for four straight years in a city that neared 500 in 1990. The number of violent crimes, property crimes and robberies are lower than they've been in at least four decades.
